channel.title: [474] ItemOnItem; and understanding how it works

item.title: [474] ItemOnItem; and understanding how it works
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“D.Ducky911, post:6, topic:348449”][quote author=JaydenD12 link=topic=444827.msg3267804#msg3267804 date=1278981933]
Horrible conventions, secondly, this is no fucking different from any other servers item on item.
[/quote]

Mk, first of all, if this is from ‘anyother server’ than i would LOVE, to see you C+P another servers itemonitem.java, into a 474’s and tell me if it works alright?

BASE, if you want, you take it and make it good ok princess? God, damn. It’s amazing how many idiots are on Moparscape, really stuns me.[/quote]

He’s not the idiot; you are. All that is different in your ItemOnItem class than any other, is the packaging and the methods used to receive the data that is sent from the client (e.g. readSignedWordBigEndian()).

If you think that this is different or superior to any other, then you are fucking stupid.

P.S; your conventions are atrocious.

Read full topic
item.source: [474] ItemOnItem; and understanding how it works

item.title: [474] ItemOnItem; and understanding how it works
item.dc:creator: @D.Ducky911 D.Ducky911
item.description:
@D.Ducky911 wrote:

FOR TEH LULZ… IM PRESS X FOR SEX, OFF OF RUNE-SERBA.

I have decided, to release some 474 tutorials, that i found where difficult along the way. Hopefully in the future, people decide to switch over to 474, and use these (:.

So first, Save a file in:

io-packets

Next, save a file namnded;

[code]package com.Superiority.io.packets;

import com.Superiority.Engine;
import com.Superiority.model.players.Player;
import com.Superiority.model.players.items.PlayerItems;

/**

  • Item On Item, Makes another item+deletes a item slot.
  • @author, Rob
  • @google FTW

*/

public class ItemOnItem implements Packet {

/*
 * Handles the item on item packet
 * @param P The player instance
 * @param packetId The packet id
 * @param packetSize The packet size
 */
public void handlePacket(Player p, int packetId, int packetSize) {
	int usedWith = p.stream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
	int itemUsed = p.stream.readSignedWordA();
	int usedWithSlot = p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
	int itemUsedSlot = p.stream.readUnsignedWordA();
	System.out.println("used with: "+usedWith+" itemUsed: "+itemUsed);
    if(itemUsed == 590) {
    	System.out.println("example worked.");
    	p.getSkills().getFiremaking().lightFire(p, 590, usedWith, Engine.items.getItemName(usedWith).toLowerCase());
    }
    if(usedWith == 590) {
    	System.out.println("example failed, you suck.");
    }
}

}[/CODE]

Allow me to example… THIS:

if(itemUsed == 590) { System.out.println("example worked."); p.getSkills().getFiremaking().lightFire(p, 590, usedWith, Engine.items.getItemName(usedWith).toLowerCase()); } if(usedWith == 590) { System.out.println("example failed, you suck."); } }

“if(itemUsed == 590) {” Will be the desired item, you would like to set item #1 as. This will be the first item, being used, in your item.item class.

" p.getSkills().getFiremaking().lightFire(p, 590, usedWith, Engine.items.getItemName(usedWith).toLowerCase());" Delete this waste of a code, you will not need this. BUT, you need to edit this, so the code knows what you want it too do… Meaning, if you wanna light a fire, like in the example, you need this, to tell it what anim to use, and what GFX to add. Also, i edited this, so it knows the create this object, FIRE.

" if(usedWith == 590) {
System.out.println(“example failed, you suck.”);
}" Finally, this is the other item this is being used with. So, your code will look like this, to make it simple…

if(itemUsed == 590) { } if(usedWith == 590) { System.out.println("Congrats, ___, taught you something!");

And thats basically it guys, good luck on your #474’s (:

Read full topic
